Today, the Senate has more women serving in the chamber than ever before. But with women only representing 21 of 100 Senate seats, we still have more work to do.

50 YEARS AGO today, a fire in the Apollo 1 spacecraft killed all three crewmembers ‚Äì Gus Grissom, Ed White and Roger Chaffee ‚Äì during a routine test. The tragedy was a major setback for the Apollo program. But the sacrifice of the Apollo 1 astronauts would ultimately pave the way for the Apollo 11 moon landing in July 1969.

Had a fun visit to Lindale Middle School in Linthicum Heights, where I learned about a really cool project by 8th-grade STEM students who are working to save the dying bee population. Due to climate change, pesticides and other negative human impacts, the world‚Äôs bee population is rapidly declining. But thanks to innovative projects, like the one designed by students at Lindale Middle School, scientists are discovering new ways to help protect the global bee population. #BeeAHero

President Donald J. Trump and newly confirmed EPA Administrator #DirtyPruitt are planning to eviscerate the Chesapeake Bay Program. This is an unconscionable and reckless plan. Maryland‚Äôs economy depends on the Bay. It‚Äôs a national environmental treasure and the soul of our state. For the last several years, we‚Äôve made steady progress in improving the Bay‚Äôs health. Slashing the Chesapeake Bay cleanup program by more than 93% would be a devastating mistake.

It was incredibly inspiring and deeply moving to see so many people come together to condemn the bigotry and the hate, and to affirm our shared values of religious tolerance, respect and kindness.

If you‚Äôre looking for one way to celebrate #WomensHistoryMonth this weekend, look no further than the grand opening of the Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad Park in Church Creek, Maryland! Entry is free this weekend and the park offers several immersive exhibits that showcase Harriet Tubman‚Äôs life. Beyond her work with the Underground Railroad, Tubman was a strong supporter of the women‚Äôs suffrage movement, the first African-American woman to serve in the military and the first woman to lead an armed military expedition.

75 YEARS AGO TODAY, the U.S. Navy successfully fended off an attack on Midway Atoll by the Empire of Japan. In what became known as the Battle of Midway, U.S. forces sank four Japanese carriers and greatly weakened Japan‚Äôs ability to conduct offensive naval operations for the duration of the Second World War.
Proud to represent Howard County, which is leading the charge against big-money politics.

Special shoutout to Howard County, whose County Council officially established a bold new system of citizen-owned elections last night to fight back against big-money politics. Howard County Executive Allan H. Kittleman threatened to veto the bill. But he faces a veto-proof majority in the County Council, along with strong support of citizen-owned elections from people in Howard County, who want to return to a government of, by and for the people.
